data.title: Tennis legend Martina Navratilova gets diagnosed with two types of cancer
data.meta_description: Martina Navratilova, an 18-time Grand Slam champion, has been diagnosed with two types of cancers: throat and breast at the age of 66. She has vowed to fight the cancer battle with all she has got.
data.text:
Synopsis

Martina Navratilova, an 18-time Grand Slam champion, has been diagnosed with two types of cancers: throat and breast at the age of 66. She has vowed to fight the cancer battle with all she has got.

Incredible nine-time Wimbledon winner, tennis player Martina Navratilova, has been diagnosed with two types of cancer after a swollen lymph node was detected in her neck.

The tennis champion told the media and vowed to fight this deadly disease. Martina stated that these types of cancer are fixable, and she is hopeful of a favorable outcome. Adding to this, Navratilova's spokeswoman informed her fans that both cancers are at a primitive stage. After undergoing radiation therapy for breast cancer 13 years back, Martina is again detected with two cancers.

The veteran has an exemplary professional graph in tennis. Martina has won many accolades, like 59 singles and doubles Grand Slam titles and works remotely as a television pundit for many sports channels. From the prognosis, Navratilova's representative declared that medical experts would soon start her treatment.

During the WTA finals, the tennis star noticed an enlarged lymph node in her neck, which was declared first-stage throat cancer on the diagnosis. Subsequently, when undergoing throat tests, Martina was also detected with breast cancer. However, both cancers are not related to each other. Yet, they are at an initial stage and can be cured as suggested by medical professionals.

After the diagnosis, Martina felt helpless, yet she decided to spread awareness regarding women suffering and similar health problems. She has been a public campaigner for gay rights for a long time.

FAQs:

Who is Martina?

Tennis professional.

How many types of cancers has Martina been diagnosed with?

Two

Are both cancers at an early stage?

Yes
